00040 STRING_CACHE *defines_for_file_sc;
00041 STRING_CACHE **defines_for_module_sc;
00042 STRING_CACHE *modules_inputs_sc;
00043 STRING_CACHE *modules_outputs_sc;
00044 
00045 STRING_CACHE *module_names_to_idx;

00047 ast_node_t **module_instantiations_instance;
00048 int size_module_instantiations;

00058 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00059  * (function: init_parser)
00060  *-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00061 void parse_to_ast()
00062 {
00063         int i;
00064         extern FILE *yyin;
00065         extern int yylineno;
00066         
00067         /* hooks into macro at the top of verilog_flex.l that shows the tokens as they're parsed.  Set to true if you want to see it go...*/
00068         to_view_parse = FALSE;
00069 
00070         /* initialize the parser */
00071         init_parser();
00072 
00073         /* open files for parsing */
00074         if (global_args.verilog_file != NULL)
00075         {
00076                 /* make a consitant file list so we can access in compiler ... replicating what read config does for the filenames */
00077                 configuration.list_of_file_names = (char**)malloc(sizeof(char*));
00078                 configuration.num_list_of_file_names = 1;
00079                 configuration.list_of_file_names[0] = global_args.verilog_file;
00080 
00081                 yyin = fopen(global_args.verilog_file, "r");
00082                 if (yyin == NULL)
00083                 {
00084                         error_message(-1, -1, -1, "cannot open file: %s", global_args.verilog_file);
00085                 }
00086         
00087                 /* set the file name */ 
00088                 current_parse_file = 0;
00089 
00090                 /* setup the local parser structures for a file */
00091                 init_parser_for_file();
00092                 /* parse */
00093                 yyparse();
00094                 /* cleanup parser */
00095                 clean_up_parser_for_file();
00096 
00097                 fclose(yyin);
00098         }
00099         else if (global_args.config_file != NULL)
00100         {
00101                 /* read all the files in the configuration file */
00102                 for (i = 0; i < configuration.num_list_of_file_names; i++)
00103                 {
00104                         yyin = fopen(configuration.list_of_file_names[i], "r");
00105                         if (yyin == NULL)
00106                         {
00107                                 error_message(-1, -1, -1, "cannot open file: %s\n", configuration.list_of_file_names[i]);
00108                         }
00109                 
00110                         /* set the file name */ 
00111                         current_parse_file = i;
00112 
00113                         /* reset the line count */
00114                         yylineno = 0;
00115 
00116                         /* setup the local parser structures for a file */
00117                         init_parser_for_file();
00118                         /* parse next file */
00119                         yyparse();
00120                         /* cleanup parser */
00121                         clean_up_parser_for_file();
00122 
00123                         fclose(yyin);
00124                 }
00125         }
00126 
00127         /* clean up all the structures in the parser */
00128         cleanup_parser();
00129 
00130         /* for error messages - this is in case we use any of the parser functions after parsing (i.e. create_case_control_signals()) */
00131         current_parse_file = -1;
00132 }
00133 
00134 /* --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00135  --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00136  --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00137 BASIC PARSING FUNCTIONS
00138  Assume that all `defines are constants so we can change the constant into a number (see def_reduct by performing a search in this file)
00139  --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00140  --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00141  --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00142 
00143 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00144  * (function: init_parser)
00145  *-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00146 void init_parser()
00147 {
00148         defines_for_file_sc = sc_new_string_cache();
00149 
00150         defines_for_module_sc = NULL;
00151 
00152         /* record of each of the individual modules */
00153         num_modules = 0; // we're going to record all the modules in a list so we can build a tree of them later
00154         ast_modules = NULL;
00155         module_names_to_idx = sc_new_string_cache();
00156         module_instantiations_instance = NULL;
00157         size_module_instantiations = 0;
00158 
00159         /* keeps track of all the ast roots */
00160         all_file_items_list = NULL;
00161         size_all_file_items_list = 0;
00162 }
00163 
00164 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00165  * (function: cleanup_parser)
00166  *-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00167 void cleanup_parser()
00168 {
00169         int i;
00170         
00171         /* frees all the defines for module string caches (used for parameters) */
00172         if (num_modules > 0)
00173         {
00174                 for (i = 0; i < num_modules; i++)
00175                 {
00176                         sc_free_string_cache(defines_for_module_sc[i]);
00177                 }
00178                 
00179                 free(defines_for_module_sc);
00180         }
00181 }
00182 
00183 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00184  * (function: init_parser_for_file)
00185  *-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00186 void init_parser_for_file()
00187 {
00188         /* crrate a hash for defines so we can look them up when we find them */
00189         defines_for_module_sc = (STRING_CACHE**)realloc(defines_for_module_sc, sizeof(STRING_CACHE*)*(num_modules+1));
00190         defines_for_module_sc[num_modules] = sc_new_string_cache();
00191 
00192         /* create string caches to hookup PORTS with INPUT and OUTPUTs.  This is made per module and will be cleaned and remade at next_module */
00193         modules_inputs_sc = sc_new_string_cache();
00194         modules_outputs_sc = sc_new_string_cache();
00195 }
00196 
00197 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00198  * (function: clean_up_parser_for_file)
00199  *-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00200 void clean_up_parser_for_file()
00201 {
00202         /* cleanup the defines hash */
00203         sc_free_string_cache(defines_for_file_sc);
00204 }
00205 
00206 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00207  * (function: next_parsed_verilog_file)
00208  *-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00209 void next_parsed_verilog_file(ast_node_t *file_items_list)
00210 {
00211         /* optimization entry point */
00212         printf("Optimizing module by AST based optimizations\n");
00213         optimizations_on_AST(file_items_list);
00214 
00215         if (configuration.output_ast_graphs == 1)
00216         {
00217                 /* IF - we want outputs for the graphViz files of each file */
00218                 graphVizOutputAst(configuration.debug_output_path, file_items_list);
00219         }
00220 
00221         /* store the root of this files ast */
00222         all_file_items_list = (ast_node_t**)realloc(all_file_items_list, sizeof(ast_node_t*)*(size_all_file_items_list+1));
00223         all_file_items_list[size_all_file_items_list] = file_items_list;
00224         size_all_file_items_list ++;
00225 }
00226 
00227 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00228  * (function: newSymbolNode)
00229  *-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00230 ast_node_t *newSymbolNode(char *id, int line_number)
00231 {
00232         long sc_spot;
00233         ast_node_t *current_node;
00234 
00235         if (id[0] == '`')
00236         {
00237                 /* IF - this is a define replace with number constant */ 
00238                 /* def_reduct */
00239 
00240                 /* get the define symbol from the string cache */
00241                 if ((sc_spot = sc_lookup_string(defines_for_file_sc, (id+1))) == -1)
00242                 {
00243                         error_message(PARSE_ERROR, line_number, current_parse_file, "Define \"%s\" used but not declared\n", id);
00244                 }
00245 
00246                 /* return the number node */
00247                 return (ast_node_t*)defines_for_file_sc->data[sc_spot];
00248         }
00249         else if ((sc_spot = sc_lookup_string(defines_for_module_sc[num_modules], id)) != -1)
00250         {
00251                 /* return the number node. Likely, for a parameter definition in a module. */
00252                 return (ast_node_t*)defines_for_module_sc[num_modules]->data[sc_spot];
00253         }
00254         else
00255         {
00256                 /* create node */
00257                 current_node = create_tree_node_id(id, line_number, current_parse_file);
00258         }
00259 
00260         return current_node;
00261 }
00262 
00263 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00264  * (function: newNumberNode)
00265  *-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00266 ast_node_t *newNumberNode(char *num, int line_number)
00267 {
00268         ast_node_t *current_node = create_tree_node_number(num, line_number, current_parse_file);
00269         return current_node;
00270 }

00272 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00273  * (function: newList)
00274  *-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00275 ast_node_t *newList(short node_type, ast_node_t *child)
00276 {
00277         /* create a node for this array reference */
00278         ast_node_t* new_node = create_node_w_type(node_type, yylineno, current_parse_file);
00279         /* allocate child nodes to this node */
00280         allocate_children_to_node(new_node, 1, child);
00281 
00282         return new_node;
00283 }
00284 
00285 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00286  * (function: newList_entry)
00287  *-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00288 ast_node_t *newList_entry(ast_node_t *list, ast_node_t *child)
00289 {
00290         /* allocate child nodes to this node */
00291         add_child_to_node(list, child);
00292 
00293         return list;
00294 }

00296 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00297  * (function: markAndProcessSymbolListWith)
00298  *-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00299 ast_node_t *markAndProcessSymbolListWith(short id, ast_node_t *symbol_list)
00300 {
00301         int i;
00302         long sc_spot;
00303         ast_node_t *range_min = 0;
00304         ast_node_t *range_max = 0;
00305 
00306         for (i = 0; i < symbol_list->num_children; i++)
00307         {
00308                 /* checks range is legal */
00309                 get_range(symbol_list->children[i]);
00310 
00311                 if ((i == 0) && (symbol_list->children[0]->children[1] != NULL)&& (symbol_list->children[0]->children[2] != NULL) && (symbol_list->children[0]->children[1]->type == NUMBERS) && (symbol_list->children[0]->children[2]->type == NUMBERS))
00312                 {
00313                         range_max = symbol_list->children[0]->children[1];
00314                         range_min = symbol_list->children[0]->children[2];
00315                 }
00316 
00317                 if ((symbol_list->children[i]->children[1] == NULL) && (symbol_list->children[i]->children[2] == NULL))
00318                 {
00319                         symbol_list->children[i]->children[1] = range_max;
00320                         symbol_list->children[i]->children[2] = range_min;
00321                 }
00322 
00323                 switch(id)
00324                 {
00325                         case PORT:
00326                         {
00327                                 short found_match = FALSE;
00328 
00329                                 symbol_list->children[i]->types.variable.is_port = TRUE;
00330                                 
00331                                 /* find the related INPUT or OUTPUT definition and store that instead */
00332                                 if ((sc_spot = sc_lookup_string(modules_inputs_sc, symbol_list->children[i]->children[0]->types.identifier)) != -1)
00333                                 {
00334                                         symbol_list->children[i]->types.variable.is_input = TRUE;
00335                                         symbol_list->children[i]->children[0] = (ast_node_t*)modules_inputs_sc->data[sc_spot];
00336                                         found_match = TRUE;
00337                                 }
00338                                 if ((found_match == FALSE) && ((sc_spot = sc_lookup_string(modules_outputs_sc, symbol_list->children[i]->children[0]->types.identifier)) != -1))
00339                                 {
00340                                         symbol_list->children[i]->types.variable.is_output = TRUE;
00341                                         symbol_list->children[i]->children[0] = (ast_node_t*)modules_outputs_sc->data[sc_spot];
00342                                         found_match = TRUE;
00343                                 }
00344                                 
00345                                 if (found_match == FALSE)
00346                                 {
00347                                         error_message(PARSE_ERROR, symbol_list->children[i]->line_number, current_parse_file, "No matching input declaration for port %s\n", symbol_list->children[i]->children[0]->types.identifier);
00348                                 }
00349                                 break;
00350                         }
00351                         case PARAMETER:
00352                         {
00353                                 int binary_range;
00354                                 if (i == 0)
00355                                 {
00356                                         binary_range = get_range(symbol_list->children[i]);
00357                                 }
00358                                 
00359                                 /* fifth spot in the children list holds a parameter value */
00360                                 if (binary_range != -1)
00361                                 {
00362                                         /* check that the parameter size matches the number included */
00363                                          if((symbol_list->children[i]->children[5]->types.number.size != 0) 
00364                                                 && (symbol_list->children[i]->children[5]->types.number.base == BIN) 
00365                                                 && (symbol_list->children[i]->children[5]->types.number.size != binary_range)) 
00366                                         {
00367                                                 error_message(PARSE_ERROR, symbol_list->children[i]->children[5]->line_number, current_parse_file, "parameter %s and range %d don't match\n", symbol_list->children[i]->children[0]->types.identifier, binary_range);
00368                                         }
00369                                         else
00370                                         {
00371                                                 symbol_list->children[i]->children[5]->types.number.size = binary_range; // assign the binary range 
00372                                         }
00373                                 }
00374 
00375                                 /* create an entry in the symbol table for this parameter */
00376                                 if ((sc_spot = sc_add_string(defines_for_module_sc[num_modules], symbol_list->children[i]->children[0]->types.identifier)) == -1)
00377                                 {
00378                                         error_message(PARSE_ERROR, symbol_list->children[i]->children[5]->line_number, current_parse_file, "define has same name (%s).  Other define migh be in another file.  Odin considers a define as global.\n", 
00379                                                 symbol_list->children[i]->children[0]->types.identifier, 
00380                                                 ((ast_node_t*)(defines_for_module_sc[num_modules]->data[sc_spot]))->line_number);
00381                                 }
00382                                 /* store the data - which is the number node */
00383                                 if (symbol_list->children[i]->children[5]->types.number.base == DEC)
00384                                 {
00385                                         error_message(PARSE_ERROR, symbol_list->children[i]->children[5]->line_number, current_parse_file, "Odin only accepts parameter %s with defined width\n", symbol_list->children[i]->children[0]->types.identifier);
00386                                 }
00387                                 defines_for_module_sc[num_modules]->data[sc_spot] = (void*)symbol_list->children[i]->children[5];
00388                                 /* mark the node as shared so we don't delete it */
00389                                 symbol_list->children[i]->children[5]->shared_node = TRUE;
00390                                 
00391                                 /* now do the mark */
00392                                 symbol_list->children[i]->types.variable.is_parameter = TRUE;
00393                                 break;
00394                         }
00395                         case INPUT:
00396                                 symbol_list->children[i]->types.variable.is_input = TRUE;
00397                                 /* add this input to the modules string cache */
00398                                 if ((sc_spot = sc_add_string(modules_inputs_sc, symbol_list->children[i]->children[0]->types.identifier)) == -1)
00399                                 {
00400                                         error_message(PARSE_ERROR, symbol_list->children[i]->children[0]->line_number, current_parse_file, "Module already has input with this name %s\n", symbol_list->children[i]->children[0]->types.identifier);
00401                                 }
00402                                 /* store the data which is an idx here */
00403                                 modules_inputs_sc->data[sc_spot] = (void*)symbol_list->children[i];
00404                                 break;
00405                         case OUTPUT:
00406                                 symbol_list->children[i]->types.variable.is_output = TRUE;
00407                                 /* add this output to the modules string cache */
00408                                 if ((sc_spot = sc_add_string(modules_outputs_sc, symbol_list->children[i]->children[0]->types.identifier)) == -1)
00409                                 {
00410                                         error_message(PARSE_ERROR, symbol_list->children[i]->children[0]->line_number, current_parse_file, "Module already has input with this name %s\n", symbol_list->children[i]->children[0]->types.identifier);
00411                                 }
00412                                 /* store the data which is an idx here */
00413                                 modules_outputs_sc->data[sc_spot] = (void*)symbol_list->children[i];
00414                                 break;
00415                         case INOUT:
00416                                 symbol_list->children[i]->types.variable.is_inout = TRUE;
00417                                 error_message(PARSE_ERROR, symbol_list->children[i]->children[0]->line_number, current_parse_file, "Odin does not handle inouts (%s)\n");
00418                                 break;
00419                         case WIRE:
00420                                 symbol_list->children[i]->types.variable.is_wire = TRUE;
00421                                 break;
00422                         case REG:
00423                                 symbol_list->children[i]->types.variable.is_reg = TRUE;
00424                                 break;
00425                         default:
00426                                 oassert(FALSE);
00427                 }
00428         }
00429 
00430         return symbol_list;
00431 }
00432 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00433  * (function: newArrayRef)
00434  *-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00435 ast_node_t *newArrayRef(char *id, ast_node_t *expression, int line_number)
00436 {
00437         /* allocate or check if there's a node for this */
00438         ast_node_t *symbol_node = newSymbolNode(id, line_number);
00439         /* create a node for this array reference */
00440         ast_node_t* new_node = create_node_w_type(ARRAY_REF, line_number, current_parse_file);
00441         /* allocate child nodes to this node */
00442         allocate_children_to_node(new_node, 2, symbol_node, expression);
00443 
00444         return new_node;
00445 }
00446 
00447 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00448  * (function: newRangeRef)
00449  *-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00450 ast_node_t *newRangeRef(char *id, ast_node_t *expression1, ast_node_t *expression2, int line_number)
00451 {
00452         /* allocate or check if there's a node for this */
00453         ast_node_t *symbol_node = newSymbolNode(id, line_number);
00454         /* create a node for this array reference */
00455         ast_node_t* new_node = create_node_w_type(RANGE_REF, line_number, current_parse_file);
00456         /* allocate child nodes to this node */
00457         allocate_children_to_node(new_node, 3, symbol_node, expression1, expression2);
00458         /* swap the direction so in form [MSB:LSB] */
00459         get_range(new_node);
00460 
00461         return new_node;
00462 }
00463 
00464 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00465  * (function: newBinaryOperation)
00466  *-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00467 ast_node_t *newBinaryOperation(short op_id, ast_node_t *expression1, ast_node_t *expression2, int line_number)
00468 {
00469         info_ast_visit_t *node_details = NULL;
00470         /* create a node for this array reference */
00471         ast_node_t* new_node = create_node_w_type(BINARY_OPERATION, line_number, current_parse_file);
00472         /* store the operation type */
00473         new_node->types.operation.op = op_id;
00474         /* allocate child nodes to this node */
00475         allocate_children_to_node(new_node, 2, expression1, expression2);
00476 
00477         /* see if this binary expression can have some constant folding */
00478         node_details = constantFold(new_node);
00479         if ((node_details != NULL) && (node_details->is_constant_folded == TRUE))
00480         {
00481                 new_node = node_details->from;
00482                 free(node_details);
00483         }
00484 
00485         return new_node;
00486 }
00487 
00488 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00489  * (function: newUnaryOperation)
00490  *-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00491 ast_node_t *newUnaryOperation(short op_id, ast_node_t *expression, int line_number)
00492 {
00493         info_ast_visit_t *node_details = NULL;
00494         /* create a node for this array reference */
00495         ast_node_t* new_node = create_node_w_type(UNARY_OPERATION, line_number, current_parse_file);
00496         /* store the operation type */
00497         new_node->types.operation.op = op_id;
00498         /* allocate child nodes to this node */
00499         allocate_children_to_node(new_node, 1, expression);
00500 
00501         /* see if this binary expression can have some constant folding */
00502         node_details = constantFold(new_node);
00503         if ((node_details != NULL) && (node_details->is_constant_folded == TRUE))
00504         {
00505                 new_node = node_details->from;
00506                 free(node_details);
00507         }
00508 
00509         return new_node;
00510 }

00568 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00569  * (function: newNonBlocking)
00570  *-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00571 ast_node_t *newNonBlocking(ast_node_t *expression1, ast_node_t *expression2, int line_number)
00572 {
00573         /* create a node for this array reference */
00574         ast_node_t* new_node = create_node_w_type(NON_BLOCKING_STATEMENT, line_number, current_parse_file);
00575         /* allocate child nodes to this node */
00576         allocate_children_to_node(new_node, 2, expression1, expression2);
00577 
00578         return new_node;
00579 }
00580

00585 {

00588         /* allocate child nodes to this node */
00589         allocate_children_to_node(new_node, 2, expression1, expression2);
00590 
00591         return new_node;
00592 }

00596  *-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00597 ast_node_t *newIf(ast_node_t *compare_expression, ast_node_t *true_expression, ast_node_t *false_expression, int line_number)
00598 {

00600         ast_node_t* new_node = create_node_w_type(IF, line_number, current_parse_file);
00601         /* allocate child nodes to this node */
00602         allocate_children_to_node(new_node, 3, compare_expression, true_expression, false_expression);
00603 
00604         return new_node;
00605 }

00608  * (function: newIfQuestion) for f = a ? b : c;
00609  *-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00610 ast_node_t *newIfQuestion(ast_node_t *compare_expression, ast_node_t *true_expression, ast_node_t *false_expression, int line_number)

00616 
00617         return new_node;
00618 }

00645 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00646  * (function: newModuleConnection)
00647  *-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00648 ast_node_t *newModuleConnection(char* id, ast_node_t *expression, int line_number)
00649 {
00650         ast_node_t *symbol_node;
00651         /* create a node for this array reference */
00652         ast_node_t* new_node = create_node_w_type(MODULE_CONNECT, line_number, current_parse_file);
00653         if (id != NULL)
00654         {
00655                 symbol_node = newSymbolNode(id, line_number);
00656         }
00657         else
00658         {
00659                 symbol_node = NULL;
00660         }
00661 
00662         /* allocate child nodes to this node */
00663         allocate_children_to_node(new_node, 2, symbol_node, expression);
00664 
00665         return new_node;
00666 }

00668 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

00670  *-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00671 ast_node_t *newModuleNamedInstance(char* unique_name, ast_node_t *module_connect_list, int line_number)
00672 {
00673         ast_node_t *symbol_node = newSymbolNode(unique_name, line_number);
00674 
00675         /* create a node for this array reference */
00676         ast_node_t* new_node = create_node_w_type(MODULE_NAMED_INSTANCE, line_number, current_parse_file);
00677         /* allocate child nodes to this node */
00678         allocate_children_to_node(new_node, 2, symbol_node, module_connect_list);
00679 
00680         return new_node;
00681 }
00682 
00683 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00684  * (function: newModuleInstance)
00685  *-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00686 ast_node_t *newModuleInstance(char* module_ref_name, ast_node_t *module_named_instance, int line_number)
00687 {
00688         ast_node_t *symbol_node = newSymbolNode(module_ref_name, line_number);
00689 
00690         /* create a node for this array reference */
00691         ast_node_t* new_node = create_node_w_type(MODULE_INSTANCE, line_number, current_parse_file);
00692         /* allocate child nodes to this node */
00693         allocate_children_to_node(new_node, 2, symbol_node, module_named_instance);
00694 
00695         /* store the module symbol name that this calls in a list that will at the end be asociated with the module node */
00696         module_instantiations_instance = (ast_node_t **)realloc(module_instantiations_instance, sizeof(ast_node_t*)*(size_module_instantiations+1));
00697         module_instantiations_instance[size_module_instantiations] = new_node;
00698         size_module_instantiations++;
00699 
00700         return new_node;
00701 }
00702 
00703 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00704  * (function: newGateInstance)
00705  *-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00706 ast_node_t *newGateInstance(char* gate_instance_name, ast_node_t *expression1, ast_node_t *expression2, ast_node_t *expression3, int line_number)
00707 {
00708         /* create a node for this array reference */
00709         ast_node_t* new_node = create_node_w_type(GATE_INSTANCE, line_number, current_parse_file);
00710         ast_node_t *symbol_node = NULL;
00711 
00712         if (gate_instance_name != NULL)
00713         {
00714                 symbol_node = newSymbolNode(gate_instance_name, line_number);
00715         }
00716 
00717         /* allocate child nodes to this node */
00718         allocate_children_to_node(new_node, 4, symbol_node, expression1, expression2, expression3);
00719 
00720         return new_node;
00721 }
00722 
00723 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00724  * (function: newGate)
00725  *-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00726 ast_node_t *newGate(short op_id, ast_node_t *gate_instance, int line_number)
00727 {

00729         ast_node_t* new_node = create_node_w_type(GATE, line_number, current_parse_file);
00730         /* store the operation type */
00731         new_node->types.operation.op = op_id;
00732         /* allocate child nodes to this node */
00733         allocate_children_to_node(new_node, 1, gate_instance);
00734 
00735         return new_node;
00736 }

00746         allocate_children_to_node(new_node, 1, statement);
00747

00751 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00752  * (function: newVarDeclare)
00753  *-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00754 ast_node_t *newVarDeclare(char* symbol, ast_node_t *expression1, ast_node_t *expression2, ast_node_t *expression3, ast_node_t *expression4, ast_node_t *value, int line_number)
00755 {
00756         ast_node_t *symbol_node = newSymbolNode(symbol, line_number);
00757 
00758         /* create a node for this array reference */
00759         ast_node_t* new_node = create_node_w_type(VAR_DECLARE, line_number, current_parse_file);
00760 
00761         /* allocate child nodes to this node */
00762         allocate_children_to_node(new_node, 6, symbol_node, expression1, expression2, expression3, expression4, value);
00763 
00764         return new_node;
00765 }
00766 
00767 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00768  * (function: newModule)
00769  *-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00770 ast_node_t *newModule(char* module_name, ast_node_t *list_of_ports, ast_node_t *list_of_module_items, int line_number)
00771 {
00772         long sc_spot;
00773         ast_node_t *symbol_node = newSymbolNode(module_name, line_number);
00774 
00775         /* create a node for this array reference */
00776         ast_node_t* new_node = create_node_w_type(MODULE, line_number, current_parse_file);
00777         /* mark all the ports symbols as ports */
00778         markAndProcessSymbolListWith(PORT, list_of_ports);
00779         /* allocate child nodes to this node */
00780         allocate_children_to_node(new_node, 3, symbol_node, list_of_ports, list_of_module_items);
00781 
00782         /* store the list of modules this module instantiates */
00783         new_node->types.module.module_instantiations_instance = module_instantiations_instance;
00784         new_node->types.module.size_module_instantiations = size_module_instantiations;
00785         new_node->types.module.is_instantiated = FALSE;
00786         new_node->types.module.index = num_modules;
00787 
00788         /* record this module in the list of modules (for evaluation later in terms of just nodes) */
00789         ast_modules = (ast_node_t **)realloc(ast_modules, sizeof(ast_node_t*)*(num_modules+1));
00790         ast_modules[num_modules] = new_node;
00791 
00792         if ((sc_spot = sc_add_string(module_names_to_idx, module_name)) == -1)
00793         {
00794                 error_message(PARSE_ERROR, line_number, current_parse_file, "module names with the same name -> %s\n", module_name);
00795         }
00796         /* store the data which is an idx here */
00797         module_names_to_idx->data[sc_spot] = (void*)new_node;
00798 
00799         /* now that we've bottom up built the parse tree for this module, go to the next module */
00800         next_module();
00801 
00802         return new_node;
00803 }
00804 
00805 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00806  * (function: next_module)
00807  *-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00808 void next_module()
00809 {
00810         num_modules ++;
00811 
00812         /* define the string cache for the next module */
00813         defines_for_module_sc = (STRING_CACHE**)realloc(defines_for_module_sc, sizeof(STRING_CACHE*)*(num_modules+1));
00814         defines_for_module_sc[num_modules] = sc_new_string_cache();
00815 
00816         /* create a new list for the instantiations list */
00817         module_instantiations_instance = NULL;
00818         size_module_instantiations = 0;
00819 
00820         /* old ones are done so clean */
00821         sc_free_string_cache(modules_inputs_sc);
00822         sc_free_string_cache(modules_outputs_sc);
00823         /* make for next module */
00824         modules_inputs_sc = sc_new_string_cache();
00825         modules_outputs_sc = sc_new_string_cache();
00826 }
00827 
00828 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00829  * (function: newConstant)
00830  *-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00831 void newConstant(char *id, char *number, int line_number)
00832 {
00833         long sc_spot;
00834         ast_node_t *number_node = newNumberNode(number, line_number);
00835 
00836         /* add the define character string to the parser and maintain the number around */
00837         /* def_reduct */
00838         if ((sc_spot = sc_add_string(defines_for_file_sc, id)) == -1)
00839         {
00840                 error_message(PARSE_ERROR, current_parse_file, line_number, "define with same name (%s) on line %d\n", id, ((ast_node_t*)(defines_for_file_sc->data[sc_spot]))->line_number);
00841         }
00842         /* store the data */
00843         defines_for_file_sc->data[sc_spot] = (void*)number_node;
00844         /* mark node as shared */
00845         number_node->shared_node = TRUE;
00846 }
00847 
00848 /* --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00849  --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00850  --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00851 AST VIEWING FUNCTIONS
00852  --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00853  --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00854  --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00855 
00856 int unique_label_count;
00857 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00858  * (function: graphVizOutputAst)
00859  *-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00860 void graphVizOutputAst(char* path, ast_node_t *top)
00861 {
00862         char path_and_file[4096];
00863         FILE *fp;
00864         static int file_num = 0;
00865 
00866         /* open the file */
00867         sprintf(path_and_file, "%s/ast_%d.dot", path, file_num);
00868         fp = fopen(path_and_file, "w");
00869         file_num++;
00870 
00871         /* open graph */
00872         fprintf(fp, "digraph G {\nranksep=.25;");
00873         unique_label_count = 0;
00874         
00875         graphVizOutputAst_traverse_node(fp, top, NULL, -1);
00876 
00877         /* close graph */
00878         fprintf(fp, "}\n");
00879         fclose(fp);
00880 }
00881 
00882 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00883  * (function: graphVizOutputAst_traverse_node)
00884  *-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00885 void graphVizOutputAst_traverse_node(FILE *fp, ast_node_t *node, ast_node_t *from, int from_num)
00886 {
00887         int i;
00888         int my_label = unique_label_count;
00889 
00890         /* increase the unique count for other nodes since ours is recorded */
00891         unique_label_count++;
00892 
00893         if (node == NULL)
00894         {
00895                 /* print out the node and label details */
00896         }
00897         else
00898         {
00899                 switch(node->type)
00900                 {
00901                         case FILE_ITEMS:
00902                                 fprintf(fp, "\t%d [label=\"FILE_ITEMS\"];\n", my_label);
00903                                 break;
00904                         case MODULE: 
00905                                 fprintf(fp, "\t%d [label=\"MODULE\"];\n", my_label);
00906                                 break;
00907                         case MODULE_ITEMS:
00908                                 fprintf(fp, "\t%d [label=\"MODULE_ITEMS\"];\n", my_label);
00909                                 break;
00910                         case VAR_DECLARE:
00911                                 {
00912                                         char temp[4096] = "";
00913                                         if(node->types.variable.is_input)
00914                                         {
00915                                                 sprintf(temp, "%s INPUT", temp);
00916                                         }
00917                                         if(node->types.variable.is_output)
00918                                         {
00919                                                 sprintf(temp, "%s OUTPUT", temp);
00920                                         }
00921                                         if(node->types.variable.is_inout)
00922                                         {
00923                                                 sprintf(temp, "%s INOUT", temp);
00924                                         }
00925                                         if(node->types.variable.is_port)
00926                                         {
00927                                                 sprintf(temp, "%s PORT", temp);
00928                                         }
00929                                         if(node->types.variable.is_parameter)
00930                                         {
00931                                                 sprintf(temp, "%s PARAMETER", temp);
00932                                         }
00933                                         if(node->types.variable.is_wire)
00934                                         {
00935                                                 sprintf(temp, "%s WIRE", temp);
00936                                         }
00937                                         if(node->types.variable.is_reg)
00938                                         {
00939                                                 sprintf(temp, "%s REG", temp);
00940                                         }
00941                                         fprintf(fp, "\t%d [label=\"VAR_DECLARE %s\"];\n", my_label, temp);
00942                                 }
00943                                 break;
00944                         case VAR_DECLARE_LIST:
00945                                 fprintf(fp, "\t%d [label=\"VAR_DECLARE_LIST\"];\n", my_label);
00946                                 break;
00947                         case ASSIGN:
00948                                 fprintf(fp, "\t%d [label=\"ASSIGN\"];\n", my_label);
00949                                 break;
00950                         case GATE:
00951                                 fprintf(fp, "\t%d [label=\"GATE\"];\n", my_label);
00952                                 break;
00953                         case GATE_INSTANCE:
00954                                 fprintf(fp, "\t%d [label=\"GATE_INSTANCE\"];\n", my_label);
00955                                 break;
00956                         case MODULE_CONNECT_LIST:
00957                                 fprintf(fp, "\t%d [label=\"MODULE_CONNECT_LIST\"];\n", my_label);
00958                                 break;
00959                         case MODULE_CONNECT:
00960                                 fprintf(fp, "\t%d [label=\"MODULE_CONNECT\"];\n", my_label);
00961                                 break;
00962                         case MODULE_NAMED_INSTANCE:
00963                                 fprintf(fp, "\t%d [label=\"MODULE_NAMED_INSTANCE\"];\n", my_label);
00964                                 break;
00965                         case MODULE_INSTANCE:
00966                                 fprintf(fp, "\t%d [label=\"MODULE_INSTANCE\"];\n", my_label);
00967                                 break;
00968                         case BLOCK:
00969                                 fprintf(fp, "\t%d [label=\"BLOCK\"];\n", my_label);
00970                                 break;
00971                         case NON_BLOCKING_STATEMENT:
00972                                 fprintf(fp, "\t%d [label=\"NON_BLOCKING_STATEMENT\"];\n", my_label);
00973                                 break;
00974                         case BLOCKING_STATEMENT:
00975                                 fprintf(fp, "\t%d [label=\"BLOCKING_STATEMENT\"];\n", my_label);
00976                                 break;
00977                         case CASE:
00978                                 fprintf(fp, "\t%d [label=\"CASE\"];\n", my_label);
00979                                 break;
00980                         case CASE_LIST:
00981                                 fprintf(fp, "\t%d [label=\"CASE_LIST\"];\n", my_label);
00982                                 break;
00983                         case CASE_ITEM:
00984                                 fprintf(fp, "\t%d [label=\"CASE_ITEM\"];\n", my_label);
00985                                 break;
00986                         case CASE_DEFAULT:
00987                                 fprintf(fp, "\t%d [label=\"CASE_DEFAULT\"];\n", my_label);
00988                                 break;
00989                         case ALWAYS:
00990                                 fprintf(fp, "\t%d [label=\"ALWAYS\"];\n", my_label);
00991                                 break;
00992                         case DELAY_CONTROL:
00993                                 fprintf(fp, "\t%d [label=\"DELAY_CONTROL\"];\n", my_label);
00994                                 break;
00995                         case POSEDGE:
00996                                 fprintf(fp, "\t%d [label=\"POSEDGE\"];\n", my_label);
00997                                 break;
00998                         case NEGEDGE:
00999                                 fprintf(fp, "\t%d [label=\"NEGEDGE\"];\n", my_label);
01000                                 break;
01001                         case IF:
01002                                 fprintf(fp, "\t%d [label=\"IF\"];\n", my_label);
01003                                 break;
01004                         case IF_Q:
01005                                 fprintf(fp, "\t%d [label=\"IF_Q\"];\n", my_label);
01006                                 break;
01007                         case BINARY_OPERATION:
01008                                 switch (node->types.operation.op)
01009                                 {
01010                                         case ADD:
01011                                                 fprintf(fp, "\t%d [label=\"BINARY_OPERATION ADD\"];\n", my_label);
01012                                                 break;
01013                                         case MINUS:
01014                                                 fprintf(fp, "\t%d [label=\"BINARY_OPERATION MINUS\"];\n", my_label);
01015                                                 break;
01016                                         case BITWISE_NOT:
01017                                                 fprintf(fp, "\t%d [label=\"BINARY_OPERATION BITWISE_NOT\"];\n", my_label);
01018                                                 break;
01019                                         case BITWISE_AND:
01020                                                 fprintf(fp, "\t%d [label=\"BINARY_OPERATION BITWISE_AND\"];\n", my_label);
01021                                                 break;
01022                                         case BITWISE_OR:
01023                                                 fprintf(fp, "\t%d [label=\"BINARY_OPERATION BITWISE_OR\"];\n", my_label);
01024                                                 break;
01025                                         case BITWISE_NAND:
01026                                                 fprintf(fp, "\t%d [label=\"BINARY_OPERATION BITWISE_NAND\"];\n", my_label);
01027                                                 break;
01028                                         case BITWISE_NOR:
01029                                                 fprintf(fp, "\t%d [label=\"BINARY_OPERATION BITWISE_NOR\"];\n", my_label);
01030                                                 break;
01031                                         case BITWISE_XNOR:
01032                                                 fprintf(fp, "\t%d [label=\"BINARY_OPERATION BITWISE_XNOR\"];\n", my_label);
01033                                                 break;
01034                                         case BITWISE_XOR:
01035                                                 fprintf(fp, "\t%d [label=\"BINARY_OPERATION BITWISE_XOR\"];\n", my_label);
01036                                                 break;
01037                                         case LOGICAL_NOT:
01038                                                 fprintf(fp, "\t%d [label=\"BINARY_OPERATION LOGICAL_NOT\"];\n", my_label);
01039                                                 break;
01040                                         case LOGICAL_OR:
01041                                                 fprintf(fp, "\t%d [label=\"BINARY_OPERATION LOGICAL_OR\"];\n", my_label);
01042                                                 break;
01043                                         case LOGICAL_AND:
01044                                                 fprintf(fp, "\t%d [label=\"BINARY_OPERATION LOGICAL_AND\"];\n", my_label);
01045                                                 break;
01046                                         case MULTIPLY:
01047                                                 fprintf(fp, "\t%d [label=\"BINARY_OPERATION MULTIPLY\"];\n", my_label);
01048                                                 break;
01049                                         case DIVIDE:
01050                                                 fprintf(fp, "\t%d [label=\"BINARY_OPERATION DIVIDE\"];\n", my_label);
01051                                                 break;
01052                                         case MODULO:
01053                                                 fprintf(fp, "\t%d [label=\"BINARY_OPERATION MODULO\"];\n", my_label);
01054                                                 break;
01055                                         case LT:
01056                                                 fprintf(fp, "\t%d [label=\"BINARY_OPERATION LT\"];\n", my_label);
01057                                                 break;
01058                                         case GT:
01059                                                 fprintf(fp, "\t%d [label=\"BINARY_OPERATION GT\"];\n", my_label);
01060                                                 break;
01061                                         case LOGICAL_EQUAL:
01062                                                 fprintf(fp, "\t%d [label=\"BINARY_OPERATION LOGICAL_EQUAL\"];\n", my_label);
01063                                                 break;
01064                                         case NOT_EQUAL:
01065                                                 fprintf(fp, "\t%d [label=\"BINARY_OPERATION NOT_EQUAL\"];\n", my_label);
01066                                                 break;
01067                                         case LTE:
01068                                                 fprintf(fp, "\t%d [label=\"BINARY_OPERATION LTE\"];\n", my_label);
01069                                                 break;
01070                                         case GTE:
01071                                                 fprintf(fp, "\t%d [label=\"BINARY_OPERATION GTE\"];\n", my_label);
01072                                                 break;
01073                                         case SR:
01074                                                 fprintf(fp, "\t%d [label=\"BINARY_OPERATION SR\"];\n", my_label);
01075                                                 break;
01076                                         case SL:
01077                                                 fprintf(fp, "\t%d [label=\"BINARY_OPERATION SL\"];\n", my_label);
01078                                                 break;
01079                                         case CASE_EQUAL:
01080                                                 fprintf(fp, "\t%d [label=\"BINARY_OPERATION CASE_EQUAL\"];\n", my_label);
01081                                                 break;
01082                                         case CASE_NOT_EQUAL:
01083                                                 fprintf(fp, "\t%d [label=\"BINARY_OPERATION\"];\n", my_label);
01084                                                 break;
01085                                 }
01086                                 break;
01087                         case UNARY_OPERATION:
01088                                 switch (node->types.operation.op)
01089                                 {
01090                                         case ADD:
01091                                                 fprintf(fp, "\t%d [label=\"UNARY_OPERATION ADD\"];\n", my_label);
01092                                                 break;
01093                                         case MINUS:
01094                                                 fprintf(fp, "\t%d [label=\"UNARY_OPERATION MINUS\"];\n", my_label);
01095                                                 break;
01096                                         case BITWISE_NOT:
01097                                                 fprintf(fp, "\t%d [label=\"UNARY_OPERATION BITWISE_NOT\"];\n", my_label);
01098                                                 break;
01099                                         case BITWISE_AND:
01100                                                 fprintf(fp, "\t%d [label=\"UNARY_OPERATION BITWISE_AND\"];\n", my_label);
01101                                                 break;
01102                                         case BITWISE_OR:
01103                                                 fprintf(fp, "\t%d [label=\"UNARY_OPERATION BITWISE_OR\"];\n", my_label);
01104                                                 break;
01105                                         case BITWISE_NAND:
01106                                                 fprintf(fp, "\t%d [label=\"UNARY_OPERATION BITWISE_NAND\"];\n", my_label);
01107                                                 break;
01108                                         case BITWISE_NOR:
01109                                                 fprintf(fp, "\t%d [label=\"UNARY_OPERATION BITWISE_NOR\"];\n", my_label);
01110                                                 break;
01111                                         case BITWISE_XNOR:
01112                                                 fprintf(fp, "\t%d [label=\"UNARY_OPERATION BITWISE_XNOR\"];\n", my_label);
01113                                                 break;
01114                                         case BITWISE_XOR:
01115                                                 fprintf(fp, "\t%d [label=\"UNARY_OPERATION BITWISE_XOR\"];\n", my_label);
01116                                                 break;
01117                                         case LOGICAL_NOT:
01118                                                 fprintf(fp, "\t%d [label=\"UNARY_OPERATION LOGICAL_NOT\"];\n", my_label);
01119                                                 break;
01120                                 }
01121                                 break;
01122                         case ARRAY_REF:
01123                                 fprintf(fp, "\t%d [label=\"ARRAY_REF\"];\n", my_label);
01124                                 break;
01125                         case RANGE_REF:
01126                                 fprintf(fp, "\t%d [label=\"RANGE_REF\"];\n", my_label);
01127                                 break;
01128                         case CONCATENATE:
01129                                 fprintf(fp, "\t%d [label=\"CONCATENATE\"];\n", my_label);
01130                                 break;
01131                         case IDENTIFIERS:
01132                                 fprintf(fp, "\t%d [label=\"IDENTIFIERS:%s\"];\n", my_label, node->types.identifier);
01133                                 break;
01134                         case NUMBERS:
01135                                 switch (node->types.number.base)
01136                                 {
01137                                         case(DEC):
01138                                                 fprintf(fp, "\t%d [label=\"NUMBERS DEC:%s\"];\n", my_label, node->types.number.number);
01139                                                 break;
01140                                         case(HEX):
01141                                                 fprintf(fp, "\t%d [label=\"NUMBERS HEX:%s\"];\n", my_label, node->types.number.number);
01142                                                 break;
01143                                         case(OCT):
01144                                                 fprintf(fp, "\t%d [label=\"NUMBERS OCT:%s\"];\n", my_label, node->types.number.number);
01145                                                 break;
01146                                         case(BIN):
01147                                                 fprintf(fp, "\t%d [label=\"NUMBERS BIN:%s\"];\n", my_label, node->types.number.number);
01148                                                 break;
01149                                         case(LONG_LONG):
01150                                                 fprintf(fp, "\t%d [label=\"NUMBERS LONG_LONG:%lld\"];\n", my_label, node->types.number.value);
01151                                                 break;
01152                                 }
01153                                 break;
01154                         default:
01155                                 oassert(FALSE);
01156                 }       
01157         }
01158 
01159         if ((from != NULL) && (node != NULL))
01160         {
01161                 /* print out the connection with the previous node */
01162                 fprintf(fp, "\t%d -> %d;\n", from_num, my_label);
01163         }
01164 
01165         if (node != NULL)
01166         {
01167                 for (i = 0; i < node->num_children; i++)
01168                 {
01169                         graphVizOutputAst_traverse_node(fp, node->children[i], node, my_label);
01170                 }
01171         }
01172 }
